bio.singa.chemistry.annotations

Interface Annotatable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChemicalEntity, ComplexedChemicalEntity, Enzyme, Protein, Receptor, SmallMolecule

    public interface Annotatable
    Annotations in a chemical/biological environment are relevant information about the Object implementing this interface, albeit not directly required for any application or method of this object. The Object implementing this interface should provide a List to store individual Annotations. Methods to retrieve specific Annotations, filtered by AnnotationType or description are supplied as default implementations.

      • getAnnotationsOfType

        default java.util.List<Annotation> getAnnotationsOfType(AnnotationType type)
        Retrieves all Annotations that belong to the given AnnotationType.

      • getContentOfAnnotations

        default <ContentType> java.util.List<ContentType> getContentOfAnnotations(java.lang.Class<ContentType> expectedContent,
                                                                          AnnotationType type)
        Retrieves the content of all Annotations that belong to the given AnnotationType.
        Type Parameters:
        ContentType - Any class will suffice. The user (you, using this method) needs to make sure that the content of the Annotation is castable into the expected class.
        Parameters:
        expectedContent - The class of the resulting content.
        type - The AnnotationType of the Annotations to gather.
        Returns:
        The content of all Annotations that belong to the given AnnotationType.

      • getContentOfAnnotations

        default <ContentType> java.util.List<ContentType> getContentOfAnnotations(java.lang.Class<ContentType> expectedContent,
                                                                          java.lang.String description,
                                                                          AnnotationType type)
        Retrieves the content of all Annotations that belong to the given AnnotationType and description.
        Type Parameters:
        ContentType - Any class will suffice. The user (you, using this method) needs to make sure that the content of the Annotation is castable into the expected class.
        Parameters:
        expectedContent - The class of the resulting content.
        description - The desired description.
        type - The AnnotationType of the Annotations to gather.
        Returns:
        tThe content of all Annotations that belong to the given AnnotationType and description.

      • getContentOfAnnotation

        default <ContentType> ContentType getContentOfAnnotation(java.lang.Class<ContentType> expectedContent,
                                                         AnnotationType type)
        Retrieves the first Annotation matching the given AnnotationType. This method can be used if you are only expecting one instance of an Annotation to be in the List of Annotations.
        Type Parameters:
        ContentType - Any class will suffice. The user (you, using this method) needs to make sure that the content of the Annotation is castable into the expected class.
        Parameters:
        expectedContent - The class of the resulting content.
        type - The AnnotationType of the Annotations to gather.
        Returns:
        The first Annotation matching the given AnnotationType

      • getContentOfAnnotation

        default <ContentType> ContentType getContentOfAnnotation(java.lang.Class<ContentType> expectedContent,
                                                         java.lang.String description,
                                                         AnnotationType type)
        Retrieves the first Annotation matching the given AnnotationType and description. This method can be used if you are only expecting one instance of an Annotation to be in the List of Annotations.
        Type Parameters:
        ContentType - Any class will suffice. The user (you, using this method) needs to make sure that the content of the Annotation is castable into the expected class.
        Parameters:
        expectedContent - The class of the resulting content.
        description - The desired description.
        type - The AnnotationType of the Annotations to gather.
        Returns:
        The first Annotation matching the given AnnotationType and description
